name: Blu-ray Movie Playlist File
summary: Learn about .MPLS files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Software Blu-ray players such as Leawo Blu-ray Player or PowerDVD, and Blu-ray authoring tools, can interpret MPLS files to manage and preview disc content. While players typically handle MPLS files in the background, users working with Blu-ray rips or backups may encounter MPLS files when organizing or analyzing disc structure.
Specific information that an MPLS file typically contains:
Clip references: Which M2TS files (clips) are played
Start and end times: Defines time ranges within each clip
Playback order: Which clips to play and in what sequence
Chapter information: Points that correspond to user-accessible chapters
Multi-angle and multi-version logic: MPLS can reference different angles or language versions without duplicating video data

description: An MPLS file is a Blu-ray playlist that defines the playback order of video clips on a Blu-ray disc, including the order of chapters and branching video paths (like language or viewing options). It does not contain actual video or audio data, but instead lists the sequence of media files, known as "M2TS streams," that make up a full movie or feature. MPLS files are typically named with a five-digit code (e.g., 00001.mpls) and is saved in the BDMV/PLAYLIST folder on the disc.

instructions: You can open MPLS files with various programs, including Roxio Toast, Cyberlink PowerDVD, and VideoLAN VLC media player. However, these programs do not directly open the files. Instead, they load the files to play the video clips they reference.
